column4: new ubuntu user would like to know how to save changes to  the /etc/x11/xorg.conf file
it's owned by root, so you have to sudo (super user do) in order to edit it
sorry lotus i am a new user
open a terminal, type sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf   then make your changes and write the file
when i make the change in my NVIDIA X server Settings, i get the error unable to remove old x config backup
when i make the change in my NVIDIA X server Settings, i get the error unable to remove old x config backup
try moving xorg.conf.bk or whatever it's called to a new location and trying again
or open nvidia-config (is that what it's caleld?) by hitting alt+f2 and then typing gksudo nvidia-config
Lotus i cannot do the solution you proposed because i think i do not understand enough
i would like to be able to change mmy screen resolution to native 1680-1050 using nvidia x server settings
try to find out the name of the nvidia tool.  try copying the launcher from the admin menu to the desktop and then checking what it points to
then when you get the command name to run the tool, use alt+f2 to open a run dialog, then type in "gksudo <toolname>"
yes it is for my laptop screen
that should run the tool as root when you enter your password
